:target{#wsgi-protocol-linter}

# WSGI Protocol Linter

This module provides a middleware that performs sanity checks on the
behavior of the WSGI server and application. It checks that the
[<strong>PEP 3333</strong>](https://peps.python.org/pep-3333/) WSGI spec is properly implemented. It also warns on some
common HTTP errors such as non-empty responses for 304 status codes.

<Outline domain="py" objectType="class" target={"werkzeug.middleware.lint.LintMiddleware"} module={"werkzeug.middleware.lint"} fullname={"LintMiddleware"} parameters={["app"]} description={"Warns about common errors in the WSGI and HTTP behavior of the\nserver and wrapped application. Some of the issues it checks are:"}>
  <Outline.Signature fullname="LintMiddleware" id="werkzeug.middleware.lint.LintMiddleware">
    <Outline.Keyword>class<span>{" "}</span></Outline.Keyword><Outline.Prefix>werkzeug.middleware.lint.</Outline.Prefix><Outline.Name>LintMiddleware</Outline.Name><Outline.ParameterList><span>(</span><Outline.Parameter><span className="name">app</span></Outline.Parameter><span>)</span></Outline.ParameterList>
  </Outline.Signature>

  <Outline.Content>
    Warns about common errors in the WSGI and HTTP behavior of the
    server and wrapped application. Some of the issues it checks are:

    - invalid status codes
    - non-bytes sent to the WSGI server
    - strings returned from the WSGI application
    - non-empty conditional responses
    - unquoted etags
    - relative URLs in the Location header
    - unsafe calls to wsgi.input
    - unclosed iterators

    Error information is emitted using the [`warnings`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/warnings.html#module-warnings "(in Python v3.11)") module.

    <FieldList>
      <dl>
        <dt className="field-name">
          Parameters
        </dt>

        <dd className="field-body">
          <Outline.ParameterTarget>app</Outline.ParameterTarget> (<em>WSGIApplication</em>) â€“ The WSGI application to wrap.
        </dd>
      </dl>
    </FieldList>

    ```python
    from werkzeug.middleware.lint import LintMiddleware
    app = LintMiddleware(app)
    ```
  </Outline.Content>
</Outline>
